name: Boxer
description: The Boxer is an energetic, intelligent, and loyal breed with a playful spirit. Known for their muscular build and affectionate personality, Boxers make excellent family dogs and companions for active lifestyles.

adaptability.description: Boxers are sensitive to extreme temperatures. Protect them from excessive heat and cold due to their short coat and brachycephalic muzzle.

diet.title: DIET
diet.mainDescription: Boxers thrive on a high-protein, nutrient-dense diet that supports muscle maintenance, heart health, and high energy levels.

tips.title: Protein for muscles
tips.description: Select foods with 22–28% protein to sustain their lean and muscular body structure.

tips.title: Support heart health
tips.description: Boxers are prone to cardiac issues. Include taurine, L-carnitine, and Omega-3 fatty acids for heart function and coat health.

tips.title: Joint and bone support
tips.description: Provide glucosamine and calcium-rich diets to protect joints, especially for active Boxers.

tips.title: Avoid fillers
tips.description: Avoid foods with corn, soy, or wheat as they can lead to bloating or sensitivities.

training.title: BOXER TRAINING
training.mainDescription: Boxers are intelligent and energetic learners. Consistency, exercise, and positive reinforcement help channel their enthusiasm productively.

tips.title: Daily exercise
tips.description: Boxers need 1–2 hours of daily activity — brisk walks, running, or agility training to stay fit and happy.

tips.title: Early obedience training
tips.description: Start training young with clear boundaries. Use short, interactive sessions with rewards to keep them engaged.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: Boxers have a short, smooth coat that’s easy to maintain. Regular care helps control shedding and promotes healthy skin.
grooming.mainDescription: Boxers have low grooming needs but benefit from weekly brushing and hygiene maintenance.

tips.title: Weekly brushing
tips.description: Brush once a week using a soft glove or rubber brush to remove dead hair and dirt.

tips.title: Bath & nail care
tips.description: Bathe every 6–8 weeks and trim nails regularly to prevent cracking. Clean ears gently to avoid infections.
